headline.main: Debating the Benefits and Costs Of Major Surgery for Emphysema

docs.lead_paragraph: An increasingly popular new surgery for emphysema that at first appears to defy logic is at the center of an intense debate among chest surgeons and health care providers concerning its effectiveness and cost. The operation, called lung volume reduction surgery, is increasingly being offered at hospitals around the country, even as doctors argue about how it should be performed, which patients are likely to benefit and if its benefits are worth the risks and cost.

headline.main: Fine Particles In Air Cause Many Deaths, Study Suggests

docs.lead_paragraph: New calculations by an environmental group suggest that more than 5,000 deaths in the Los Angeles area and more than 4,000 in the New York area each year are caused by fine particles of air pollution that are inhaled. The group, the Natural Resources Defense Council, said that its study of 239 cities showed that, in all, 56,000 lives could be saved each year if pollution rules were changed to curb small-particle pollution that is not now regulated. That figure is similar to earlier estimates.
